trans-unit.source: This section contains or links to articles about packaging for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

trans-unit.source: Topic
trans-unit.target: Topic

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Packaging UWP apps
trans-unit.target: Packaging UWP apps

trans-unit.source: To sell your UWP app or distribute it to other users, you need to create an appxupload package for it.
trans-unit.target: To sell your UWP app or distribute it to other users, you need to create an appxupload package for it.

trans-unit.source: When you create the appxupload, another appx package will be generated to use for testing and sideloading.
trans-unit.target: When you create the appxupload, another appx package will be generated to use for testing and sideloading.

trans-unit.source: You can distribute your app directly by sideloading the appx package to a device.
trans-unit.target: You can distribute your app directly by sideloading the appx package to a device.

trans-unit.source: This article describes the process of configuring, creating and testing a UWP app package.
trans-unit.target: This article describes the process of configuring, creating and testing a UWP app package.

trans-unit.source: For more information about sideloading, see [Sideload Apps with DISM](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=231020).
trans-unit.target: For more information about sideloading, see [Sideload Apps with DISM](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=231020).

trans-unit.source: Install apps with the WinAppDeployCmd.exe tool
trans-unit.target: Install apps with the WinAppDeployCmd.exe tool

trans-unit.source: Windows Application Deployment (WinAppDeployCmd.exe) is a command line tool that can use to deploy a UWP app from a Windows 10 machine to any Windows 10 Mobile device.
trans-unit.target: Windows Application Deployment (WinAppDeployCmd.exe) is a command line tool that can use to deploy a UWP app from a Windows 10 machine to any Windows 10 Mobile device.

trans-unit.source: You can use this tool to deploy an .appx package when the Windows 10 Mobile device is connected by USB or available on the same subnet without needing Microsoft Visual Studio or the solution for that app.
trans-unit.target: You can use this tool to deploy an .appx package when the Windows 10 Mobile device is connected by USB or available on the same subnet without needing Microsoft Visual Studio or the solution for that app.

trans-unit.source: This article describes how to install UWP apps using this tool.
trans-unit.target: This article describes how to install UWP apps using this tool.

trans-unit.source: App capability declarations
trans-unit.target: App capability declarations

trans-unit.source: Capabilities must be declared in your UWP app's [package manifest](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR211474) to access certain API or resources like pictures, music, or devices like the camera or the microphone.
trans-unit.target: Capabilities must be declared in your UWP app's [package manifest](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR211474) to access certain API or resources like pictures, music, or devices like the camera or the microphone.
